reviews.review_msg: Everton is a great professor, he genuinely cares about his students and is very understanding. He is also well respected in the English department and I would recommend everyone in English take at least one course with him. He is a tough marker and makes you work hard, but it really helps improve your writing.

He's an awesome professor. I took his class (347) in last year, and I still remember its contents. He gives all the help and feedback for you to improve your writing and is super approachable. The course was a challenge, but it made my writing to improve a lot, and I hope to take his course again if I have an opportunity to do so.

Really friendly, approachable guy; super eager to discuss and exchange ideas.  Genuinely likes teaching and he's quite dedicated to making you improve.  That being said, he's a really tough marker, but if you go talk to him and as for help, you're writing can only improve for there. If you want to do anything in American Lit., he's your man.

Best professor I have ever had. No other professor has improved my writing so much...he truly cares and will spend as much time with you as you need. You must work hard in his class, but it is rewarding! Super hilarious guy, very friendly, amazingly intelligent. TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM.
The absolute best!

Everton is the best prof I've had in all my years at SFU (and trust me, I've been here a WHILE, so I've seen my fair share). I highly encourage you to go see him prior to writing your paper, and with a draft AS you write. He doesn't mind procrastinators so just do it. SO HELPFUL, great guy.

This is the second class I've taken with Everton, and my first upper level. His lectures are really dense, so I highly advised not skipping out. Seminars are full of discussion and he directs them well. He's very engaging and clear. He's also always willing to help with papers, so go talk to him! It's not an easy class, but it's totally worth it!

It's usually difficult for professors to cultivate a discussion based culture within the classroom, but somehow Everton seems to do it and do it well! Definitely not a class you can just laze about in -- he's a tough marker. However, the class is just so enjoyable that on pure edification I would recommend this class.

Really hard marker, he will see right through any attempts at sneaking your way through the course. Ripped my papers to shreds, but was SO SO SO  helpful. Will sit down with you and scrutinize your writing style. He will bend over backwards to make you a better student. Top five teachers of my entire academic career.

Fabulous prof- I can't say enough positive things about him. He made me want to go to the 8:30am classes. Incredibly helpful, knowledgeable, funny, attractive, and all-around amazing. I left knowing so much more knowledge and respect for English. If you have a chance to take a course with him, do it. You will not regret it. Make sure your papers ha

Oh, Everton. Best prof ever. Yeah, he's hot, but what's important is that he's smart, funny, passionate, considerate, and one heck of a dresser. I've had him two sems in a row now. If I could take him till grad I would. His mentoring has greatly improved my writing. Really takes extra time for the students. Best discussions ever. Every1 contributed

I've been lucky enough to have Michael for both 206 and 347 and he is AMAZING. Extremely passionate about what he teaches, whether it's Poe or Melville. He's incredibly receptive to feedback and offering extra help. If it were up to me, my entire English degree would be American Lit and taught by Michael!

The best Professor I've had at SFU hands down. I'm already trying to find out if I can take more classes from him. And yes, he's definitely a fox. I've spoken to a few other students, and he definitely has quite the female following... But it really comes from his energy and his dedication to his work. Very rare to find someone this motivating.
Great teacher! Makes class interesting, and passionate about what he does. Take his class!!!

This prof from N Carolina is a bit intense at times.  He knows what he wants, but doesn't really explain it as far as essays go.  He is ready to work with any student.  He is generally pleasant; dresses well for SFU.  He is clear about his requirements regarding reading, and to use his own words is very unhappy when students don't do the work.

Deviance in Am. Lit. He always wears a suit & tie. He's from the south'n US - 1st semester here. Great looking. Teach? gives lots of info, but nothing about what he actually wants on essays. Gives list of what he doesn't want ... lvs u guessing.  Still early in semester. . .

He is a very intense prof, and very intelligent when it comes to what he teaches. He is very willing to meet outside of class at the student's convenience. It can be difficult asking questions in class because he has difficulty interpreting questions correctly. He also loves the word "problematize," he used it way too many times...

Would definitely take another class from Ted. He's funny and always willing to meet to discuss ideas. Understanding of life outside school, but takes class seriously. He's very animated and loves to engage with students. Uses the books and articles a LOT. I highly recommend him.
Extremely willing to meet outside of class to discuss topics. Very thorough and helpful. VERY, VERY smart. I could sit through the entire four hours of class and not feel bored. I'm not joking.

Stephan is such a knowledgable prof & caring person. He is super clear with his expectation and is very open to discussions. I wouldn't miss class because it's enjoyable and you learn a lot about the world/life through the readings he chooses. Super interesting. He's passionate, approachable, and provides tons of feedback. Visit his office hours.

I have taken one course with Professor Collis and I am upset that it was so late into my university career. He made me love attending class. Very fun man but also has a great knowledge of what he teaches. Makes you want to participate in class. Very thankful to have taken a course with him

He is a fantastic prof with a true passion for the courses that he teaches. Really supportive and values creativity. Was so pleased to have experienced a course with him. I wish I could have taken more.
